description: At the Creators Project, a 12-hour marathon of alternative music, sleek digital art and indie films, artsy types turned out in their Saturday best.

title: Midterm Races Spur Feverish Drive for Donations
description: WASHINGTON  Lawmakers have been toiling away at a feverish pace here this week, working their way through breakfasts, lunches and dinners across Capitol Hill. The urgent task is not simply passing legislation, but raising money.

title: Released on Bail in Cyprus, Spy Ring Suspect Vanishes
description: ATHENS  The eleventh suspected member of a Russian spy ring broken up by the F.B.I. this week has disappeared on the Mediterranean island of Cyprus, where he was arrested but released on bail Tuesday after surrendering his passport.

title: A Revamped Playground, No Domes in Sight
description: The playground at Pier 1 in Brooklyn Bridge Park was a slightly less hip place Wednesday morning, absent its pair of sleekly space-agey stainless-steel climbing domes.

title: Nets Throw First Bucket of Paint at the Knicks
Shopping With Steven Johanknecht
description: A founding partner of the Los Angeles design firm Commune looked for entertaining pieces that work indoors and out.

title: Discounts at Desiron in SoHo
description: Desiron, a furniture showroom in SoHo, is discounting all merchandise 30 to 40 percent in July (the Cooper Chair, originally $1,950, is $1,365; the Cooper Mirror, regularly $4,200, is $2,940; the Hudson sofa, above, originally $4,400, is $3,080); 151 Wooster Street (Houston Street), (212) 353-2600, desiron.com. Good deals may be reported to deals@nytimes.com.

title: MatterMade, a New Line of Furnishings
description: MatterMade is a new collection of 30 furniture pieces and decorative accessories developed by Jamie Gray, owner and creative director of the shop Matter. Twelve designers  among them, Lindsey Adelman and Stephen Burks  created items for the line, which includes lamps, coat racks, dressers, desks, chairs and upholstered pieces.

title: Takashimaya Florist Resurfaces as Florisity
description: Fans of Takashimayas now-defunct flower shop, take note: While Takashimaya closed last month, the florist, with its remarkable pale pink English roses, double-petaled Dutch tulips and stems of baby crab apples, is still in existence, operating as a shop called Florisity in the Flatiron district.

title: Italian GD Cucine Opens New York Showroom
description: The Italian kitchen manufacturer GD Cucine will establish a beachhead in this country soon after Labor Day, when it opens its first American showroom in Manhattan.

title: 1st Dibss New Paris Gallery
description: Opening up the Paris galleries is like going home for us as a company, said Michael Bruno, the president of 1st Dibs, the online auction site, which added a Paris gallery section this week. We launched our business in 2001 in Paris at the flea market.

title: Peter Buchanan-Smith and the Urban Ax
description: IN the year since Peter Buchanan-Smith started selling axes, his dog died, he and his wife separated and he sold the house he thought he would grow old in at a big loss. Also, he parted ways with his business partner.

title: Installing Your Own Home Security System
description: INSTALLING a security system has long been considered the domain of professionals  uniformed men and women who build an electronic shield around your home and monitor it from a command center.

title: Neato Introduces the XV-11 Vacuum Robot
description: You might mistake the new Neato XV-11 Vacuum Robot for an earlier version of a robotic vacuum cleaner. That would be a mistake. While predecessors drunkenly bounced around the room until the job was done, the XV-11 is more Terminator than Ray Milland. Guided by sensors and a laser-based positioning system, the XV-11 scans and maps the area for obstacles, then meticulously vacuums a rooms rugs, hardwood or tile in tidy rows  avoiding walls, furniture and stairs. Once finished, the vacuum cleaner finds an open doorway and moves on to the next room.

title: Outdoor Entertaining
description: STEVEN JOHANKNECHT, a New Yorker who moved to California 11 years ago, found the transition easy, except for one aspect of life: earthquakes. I adjusted to some occasional tremors, he said. But some of my things did not adjust so easily.

title: Ivan Braun, Who Turns Felled Trees Into Bowls
description: The New York Botanical Garden in the Bronx has found a way to give its fallen trees a new life: as hand-turned bowls and vases made by Ivan Braun, a woodworker from the Bronx. The one-of-a-kind objects, sold at the garden, are crafted in yew, red maple, plum, juniper, white oak, cherry, apple and zelkova, a Japanese elm. (Mr. Braun used the zelkova to create dramatically striated bowls with a pinto-pony effect, right.) They range from $45 to $145.

title: Witching Hour Past for Icahns Lions Gate Bid
description: Time has run out for Carl C. Icahns hostile tender offer for Lions Gate Entertainment  but do investors really care?

title: Me, Myself and iPhone
This Years Model: Me
description: Two photographers demonstrate the self-shooting basics with iPhones.

title: House Gives Final Approval to Financial Overhaul
description: The House on Wednesday adopted legislation to revamp the nations financial regulatory system, in a party-line vote that illustrated how the partisan bitterness in Congress prevented cooperation even on the shared goal of averting future economic crises and government bailouts of big banks, The New York Timess David M. Herszenhorn reports from Washington.

title: Financial Overhaul Wins Final Approval in House
description: WASHINGTON  The House on Wednesday adopted legislation to revamp the nations financial regulatory system, voting mostly along party lines as partisan acrimony impeded cooperation even on the shared goals of averting future economic crises.

title: Before the Entrees, Apps to Winnow Choices and Find Seats
description: Smartphones have made it simple to find a restaurant at the last minute. The gastronomic triumvirate of Urbanspoon, Yelp and OpenTable each have well-designed mobile apps for Android, BlackBerry and iPhone users, and theyre all free.

title: Accused of Espionage, but Praised as Moms and Dads
description: Among the 11 people arrested this week on suspicions of espionage were four couples, which brought much about their suburban lives into question  except, perhaps, for their parenting.

description: [7:49 a.m. | Updated Weve added videos of the goals commenters have argued most vociferously for inclusion. They appear at the bottom of the post.]

description: A. J. Burnett had no answers for his struggles. He sought the help of teammates and consulted video of his past outing.

title: Afghan Soldiers Went AWOL in Texas
description: HOUSTON  If the 17 foreign soldiers who walked away from language training at Lackland Air Force Base in San Antonio had been from, say, Guatemala or Kenya, they probably would not have received much attention. Military officials say it is not uncommon for officers visiting from countries where life is hard to get a glimpse of the American dream while studying here and go absent without leave.

title: Fury at the Sounds of South Africas World Cup
description: Johannesburg
